analysis.visualization.analysis_plotsÂ¶

Source: src\analysis\visualization\analysis_plots.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Analysis visualization tools for control engineering applications.

This module provides comprehensive visualization capabilities for analysis results including performance plots, comparison charts, and interactive visualizations.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#==================== src/analysis/visualization/analysis_plots.py ====================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Analysis visualization tools for control engineering applications.
  6
  7This module provides comprehensive visualization capabilities for analysis results
  8including performance plots, comparison charts, and interactive visualizations.
  9"""
 10
 11from __future__ import annotations
 12
 13from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Tuple, Any, Union
 14import numpy as np
 15import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 16import matplotlib.patches as patches
 17from matplotlib.patches import Ellipse
 18# Use matplotlib directly instead of seaborn for minimal dependencies
 19# Set style to match common seaborn defaults
 20plt.style.use('default')
 21plt.rcParams.update({
 22    'figure.facecolor': 'white',
 23    'axes.spines.top': False,
 24    'axes.spines.right': False,
 25    'axes.grid': True,
 26    'grid.alpha': 0.3
 27})
 28from scipy import stats
 29import warnings
 30from pathlib import Path
 31
 32from ..core.interfaces import VisualizationGenerator, AnalysisResult
 33from ..core.data_structures import PerformanceMetrics, MetricResult
 34
 35
 36class AnalysisPlotter(VisualizationGenerator):
 37    """Professional analysis plotting framework."""
 38
 39    def __init__(self, style: str = "scientific", figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (10, 6),
 40                 dpi: int = 300, color_palette: str = "viridis"):
 41        """Initialize analysis plotter.
 42
 43        Parameters
 44        ----------
 45        style : str, optional
 46            Plot style ("scientific", "presentation", "publication")
 47        figsize : Tuple[float, float], optional
 48            Default figure size
 49        dpi : int, optional
 50            Figure DPI for high-quality output
 51        color_palette : str, optional
 52            Color palette name
 53        """
 54        self.style = style
 55        self.figsize = figsize
 56        self.dpi = dpi
 57        self.color_palette = color_palette
 58        self._setup_style()
 59
 60    def _setup_style(self) -> None:
 61        """Setup matplotlib style for professional plots."""
 62        plt.style.use('seaborn-v0_8' if hasattr(plt.style, 'seaborn-v0_8') else 'default')
 63
 64        # Professional styling
 65        params = {
 66            'figure.figsize': self.figsize,
 67            'figure.dpi': self.dpi,
 68            'font.size': 12,
 69            'axes.labelsize': 14,
 70            'axes.titlesize': 16,
 71            'xtick.labelsize': 12,
 72            'ytick.labelsize': 12,
 73            'legend.fontsize': 12,
 74            'lines.linewidth': 2,
 75            'axes.grid': True,
 76            'grid.alpha': 0.3,
 77            'axes.spines.top': False,
 78            'axes.spines.right': False
 79        }
 80
 81        if self.style == "publication":
 82            params.update({
 83                'font.family': 'serif',
 84                'font.serif': ['Times New Roman'],
 85                'mathtext.fontset': 'stix',
 86                'axes.labelsize': 16,
 87                'axes.titlesize': 18,
 88                'xtick.labelsize': 14,
 89                'ytick.labelsize': 14,
 90                'legend.fontsize': 14
 91            })
 92
 93        plt.rcParams.update(params)
 94
 95    @property
 96    def supported_formats(self) -> List[str]:
 97        """List of supported output formats."""
 98        return ['png', 'pdf', 'svg', 'eps', 'jpg']
 99
100    def generate(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, **kwargs) -> str:
101        """Generate visualization from analysis results.
102
103        Parameters
104        ----------
105        analysis_result : AnalysisResult
106            Analysis results to visualize
107        **kwargs
108            Additional parameters:
109            - plot_type: Type of plot to generate
110            - output_path: Path for saving plots
111            - show_confidence_intervals: Include confidence intervals
112            - compare_baselines: Baseline data for comparison
113
114        Returns
115        -------
116        str
117            Path to generated visualization file
118        """
119        plot_type = kwargs.get('plot_type', 'summary')
120        output_path = kwargs.get('output_path', 'analysis_plot.png')
121
122        if plot_type == 'summary':
123            return self.create_summary_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
124        elif plot_type == 'performance_comparison':
125            return self.create_performance_comparison(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
126        elif plot_type == 'time_series':
127            return self.create_time_series_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
128        elif plot_type == 'distribution':
129            return self.create_distribution_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
130        elif plot_type == 'correlation_matrix':
131            return self.create_correlation_matrix(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
132        elif plot_type == 'control_performance':
133            return self.create_control_performance_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
134        else:
135            warnings.warn(f"Unknown plot type: {plot_type}")
136            return self.create_summary_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
137
138    def create_summary_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
139        """Create comprehensive summary plot."""
140        fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(15, 12))
141        fig.suptitle('Analysis Summary Dashboard', fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
142
143        try:
144            # Extract data from analysis result
145            data = analysis_result.data
146
147            # Plot 1: Key metrics bar chart
148            self._plot_key_metrics(axes[0, 0], data, **kwargs)
149
150            # Plot 2: Performance trends
151            self._plot_performance_trends(axes[0, 1], data, **kwargs)
152
153            # Plot 3: Distribution overview
154            self._plot_distribution_overview(axes[1, 0], data, **kwargs)
155
156            # Plot 4: Quality indicators
157            self._plot_quality_indicators(axes[1, 1], data, **kwargs)
158
159            plt.tight_layout()
160            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
161            plt.close()
162
163            return output_path
164
165        except Exception as e:
166            plt.close()
167            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create summary plot: {e}")
168            return ""
169
170    def create_performance_comparison(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
171        """Create performance comparison visualization."""
172        fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(18, 6))
173        fig.suptitle('Performance Comparison Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
174
175        try:
176            data = analysis_result.data
177
178            # Plot 1: Metric comparison
179            self._plot_metric_comparison(axes[0], data, **kwargs)
180
181            # Plot 2: Statistical significance
182            self._plot_statistical_significance(axes[1], data, **kwargs)
183
184            # Plot 3: Effect sizes
185            self._plot_effect_sizes(axes[2], data, **kwargs)
186
187            plt.tight_layout()
188            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
189            plt.close()
190
191            return output_path
192
193        except Exception as e:
194            plt.close()
195            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create performance comparison: {e}")
196            return ""
197
198    def create_time_series_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
199        """Create time series analysis plot."""
200        fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(14, 12))
201        fig.suptitle('Time Series Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
202
203        try:
204            data = analysis_result.data
205
206            # Plot 1: Original time series
207            self._plot_time_series_data(axes[0], data, **kwargs)
208
209            # Plot 2: Residuals analysis
210            self._plot_residuals_analysis(axes[1], data, **kwargs)
211
212            # Plot 3: Frequency domain analysis
213            self._plot_frequency_analysis(axes[2], data, **kwargs)
214
215            plt.tight_layout()
216            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
217            plt.close()
218
219            return output_path
220
221        except Exception as e:
222            plt.close()
223            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create time series plot: {e}")
224            return ""
225
226    def create_distribution_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
227        """Create distribution analysis plot."""
228        fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(14, 10))
229        fig.suptitle('Distribution Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
230
231        try:
232            data = analysis_result.data
233
234            # Plot 1: Histogram with fitted distribution
235            self._plot_histogram_with_fit(axes[0, 0], data, **kwargs)
236
237            # Plot 2: Q-Q plot
238            self._plot_qq_plot(axes[0, 1], data, **kwargs)
239
240            # Plot 3: Box plot with outliers
241            self._plot_box_plot_analysis(axes[1, 0], data, **kwargs)
242
243            # Plot 4: Probability density comparison
244            self._plot_density_comparison(axes[1, 1], data, **kwargs)
245
246            plt.tight_layout()
247            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
248            plt.close()
249
250            return output_path
251
252        except Exception as e:
253            plt.close()
254            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create distribution plot: {e}")
255            return ""
256
257    def create_correlation_matrix(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
258        """Create correlation matrix visualization."""
259        fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(16, 7))
260        fig.suptitle('Correlation Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
261
262        try:
263            data = analysis_result.data
264
265            # Plot 1: Correlation heatmap
266            self._plot_correlation_heatmap(axes[0], data, **kwargs)
267
268            # Plot 2: Correlation network
269            self._plot_correlation_network(axes[1], data, **kwargs)
270
271            plt.tight_layout()
272            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
273            plt.close()
274
275            return output_path
276
277        except Exception as e:
278            plt.close()
279            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create correlation matrix: {e}")
280            return ""
281
282    def create_control_performance_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
283        """Create control-specific performance visualization."""
284        fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 3, figsize=(18, 12))
285        fig.suptitle('Control Performance Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
286
287        try:
288            data = analysis_result.data
289
290            # Plot 1: Step response analysis
291            self._plot_step_response_analysis(axes[0, 0], data, **kwargs)
292
293            # Plot 2: Frequency response
294            self._plot_frequency_response(axes[0, 1], data, **kwargs)
295
296            # Plot 3: Stability margins
297            self._plot_stability_margins(axes[0, 2], data, **kwargs)
298
299            # Plot 4: Control effort analysis
300            self._plot_control_effort_analysis(axes[1, 0], data, **kwargs)
301
302            # Plot 5: Robustness analysis
303            self._plot_robustness_analysis(axes[1, 1], data, **kwargs)
304
305            # Plot 6: Performance summary radar
306            self._plot_performance_radar(axes[1, 2], data, **kwargs)
307
308            plt.tight_layout()
309            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
310            plt.close()
311
312            return output_path
313
314        except Exception as e:
315            plt.close()
316            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create control performance plot: {e}")
317            return ""
318
319    # Helper methods for specific plot types
320
321    def _plot_key_metrics(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
322        """Plot key metrics as bar chart."""
323        # Extract metrics from data
324        metrics = self._extract_metrics_from_data(data)
325
326        if not metrics:
327            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No metrics available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
328            ax.set_title('Key Metrics')
329            return
330
331        metric_names = list(metrics.keys())
332        metric_values = list(metrics.values())
333
334        # Create bar plot
335        bars = ax.bar(range(len(metric_names)), metric_values,
336                     color=plt.cm.get_cmap(self.color_palette)(np.linspace(0, 1, len(metric_names))))
337
338        ax.set_xlabel('Metrics')
339        ax.set_ylabel('Values')
340        ax.set_title('Key Performance Metrics')
341        ax.set_xticks(range(len(metric_names)))
342        ax.set_xticklabels(metric_names, rotation=45, ha='right')
343
344        # Add value labels on bars
345        for i, (bar, value) in enumerate(zip(bars, metric_values)):
346            ax.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2, bar.get_height() + 0.01*max(metric_values),
347                   f'{value:.3f}', ha='center', va='bottom')
348
349    def _plot_performance_trends(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
350        """Plot performance trends over time or iterations."""
351        # Look for time series data
352        time_data = self._extract_time_series_from_data(data)
353
354        if not time_data:
355            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No trend data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
356            ax.set_title('Performance Trends')
357            return
358
359        for series_name, (x_values, y_values) in time_data.items():
360            ax.plot(x_values, y_values, label=series_name, linewidth=2)
361
362        ax.set_xlabel('Time/Iteration')
363        ax.set_ylabel('Performance')
364        ax.set_title('Performance Trends')
365        ax.legend()
366        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
367
368    def _plot_distribution_overview(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
369        """Plot distribution overview."""
370        # Extract distribution data
371        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
372
373        if not dist_data:
374            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
375            ax.set_title('Distribution Overview')
376            return
377
378        # Create histogram
379        ax.hist(dist_data, bins=30, alpha=0.7, density=True, color='skyblue', edgecolor='black')
380
381        # Overlay normal distribution fit
382        try:
383            mu, sigma = stats.norm.fit(dist_data)
384            x = np.linspace(np.min(dist_data), np.max(dist_data), 100)
385            y = stats.norm.pdf(x, mu, sigma)
386            ax.plot(x, y, 'r-', linewidth=2, label=f'Normal fit (Î¼={mu:.3f}, Ïƒ={sigma:.3f})')
387        except:
388            pass
389
390        ax.set_xlabel('Value')
391        ax.set_ylabel('Density')
392        ax.set_title('Data Distribution')
393        ax.legend()
394
395    def _plot_quality_indicators(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
396        """Plot quality indicators as gauge-style visualization."""
397        # Extract quality metrics
398        quality_metrics = self._extract_quality_metrics(data)
399
400        if not quality_metrics:
401            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No quality metrics available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
402            ax.set_title('Quality Indicators')
403            return
404
405        # Create gauge plot
406        n_metrics = len(quality_metrics)
407        angles = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, n_metrics, endpoint=False)
408
409        metric_names = list(quality_metrics.keys())
410        metric_values = [quality_metrics[name] for name in metric_names]
411
412        # Normalize values to 0-1 range
413        max_val = max(metric_values) if metric_values else 1
414        normalized_values = [v/max_val for v in metric_values]
415
416        # Create polar plot
417        ax.remove()
418        ax = plt.subplot(2, 2, 4, projection='polar')
419
420        ax.plot(angles, normalized_values, 'o-', linewidth=2, color='blue')
421        ax.fill(angles, normalized_values, alpha=0.25, color='blue')
422
423        ax.set_xticks(angles)
424        ax.set_xticklabels(metric_names)
425        ax.set_ylim(0, 1)
426        ax.set_title('Quality Indicators', pad=20)
427
428    def _plot_metric_comparison(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
429        """Plot metric comparison between methods."""
430        comparison_data = self._extract_comparison_data(data)
431
432        if not comparison_data:
433            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No comparison data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
434            ax.set_title('Metric Comparison')
435            return
436
437        methods = list(comparison_data.keys())
438        metrics = list(comparison_data[methods[0]].keys()) if methods else []
439
440        x = np.arange(len(metrics))
441        width = 0.35
442
443        for i, method in enumerate(methods):
444            values = [comparison_data[method].get(metric, 0) for metric in metrics]
445            ax.bar(x + i*width, values, width, label=method, alpha=0.8)
446
447        ax.set_xlabel('Metrics')
448        ax.set_ylabel('Values')
449        ax.set_title('Method Comparison')
450        ax.set_xticks(x + width/2)
451        ax.set_xticklabels(metrics, rotation=45, ha='right')
452        ax.legend()
453
454    def _plot_statistical_significance(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
455        """Plot statistical significance results."""
456        # Extract p-values and significance results
457        significance_data = self._extract_significance_data(data)
458
459        if not significance_data:
460            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No significance data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
461            ax.set_title('Statistical Significance')
462            return
463
464        comparisons = list(significance_data.keys())
465        p_values = [significance_data[comp].get('p_value', 1.0) for comp in comparisons]
466
467        # Create significance plot
468        colors = ['red' if p < 0.05 else 'gray' for p in p_values]
469        bars = ax.barh(range(len(comparisons)), [-np.log10(p) for p in p_values], color=colors, alpha=0.7)
470
471        ax.axvline(x=-np.log10(0.05), color='red', linestyle='--', label='Î± = 0.05')
472        ax.set_xlabel('-logâ‚â‚€(p-value)')
473        ax.set_ylabel('Comparisons')
474        ax.set_title('Statistical Significance')
475        ax.set_yticks(range(len(comparisons)))
476        ax.set_yticklabels(comparisons)
477        ax.legend()
478
479    def _plot_effect_sizes(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
480        """Plot effect sizes."""
481        effect_size_data = self._extract_effect_size_data(data)
482
483        if not effect_size_data:
484            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No effect size data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
485            ax.set_title('Effect Sizes')
486            return
487
488        comparisons = list(effect_size_data.keys())
489        effect_sizes = [effect_size_data[comp] for comp in comparisons]
490
491        # Create effect size plot with interpretation colors
492        colors = []
493        for es in effect_sizes:
494            abs_es = abs(es)
495            if abs_es < 0.2:
496                colors.append('lightgray')  # Negligible
497            elif abs_es < 0.5:
498                colors.append('lightblue')  # Small
499            elif abs_es < 0.8:
500                colors.append('orange')     # Medium
501            else:
502                colors.append('red')        # Large
503
504        bars = ax.barh(range(len(comparisons)), effect_sizes, color=colors, alpha=0.7)
505
506        ax.axvline(x=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
507        ax.axvline(x=0.2, color='blue', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Small')
508        ax.axvline(x=0.5, color='orange', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Medium')
509        ax.axvline(x=0.8, color='red', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Large')
510
511        ax.set_xlabel("Cohen's d")
512        ax.set_ylabel('Comparisons')
513        ax.set_title('Effect Sizes')
514        ax.set_yticks(range(len(comparisons)))
515        ax.set_yticklabels(comparisons)
516        ax.legend()
517
518    def _plot_time_series_data(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
519        """Plot time series data."""
520        time_series = self._extract_time_series_from_data(data)
521
522        if not time_series:
523            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No time series data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
524            ax.set_title('Time Series Data')
525            return
526
527        for series_name, (times, values) in time_series.items():
528            ax.plot(times, values, label=series_name, linewidth=1.5)
529
530        ax.set_xlabel('Time')
531        ax.set_ylabel('Value')
532        ax.set_title('Time Series Data')
533        ax.legend()
534        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
535
536    def _plot_residuals_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
537        """Plot residuals analysis."""
538        residuals_data = self._extract_residuals_data(data)
539
540        if not residuals_data:
541            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No residuals data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
542            ax.set_title('Residuals Analysis')
543            return
544
545        times, residuals = residuals_data
546
547        ax.plot(times, residuals, 'b-', alpha=0.7, linewidth=1)
548        ax.axhline(y=0, color='red', linestyle='--', alpha=0.7)
549
550        # Add confidence bands
551        std_residuals = np.std(residuals)
552        ax.fill_between(times, -2*std_residuals, 2*std_residuals, alpha=0.2, color='gray', label='Â±2Ïƒ')
553
554        ax.set_xlabel('Time')
555        ax.set_ylabel('Residuals')
556        ax.set_title('Residuals Analysis')
557        ax.legend()
558        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
559
560    def _plot_frequency_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
561        """Plot frequency domain analysis."""
562        freq_data = self._extract_frequency_data(data)
563
564        if not freq_data:
565            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No frequency data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
566            ax.set_title('Frequency Analysis')
567            return
568
569        frequencies, power_spectrum = freq_data
570
571        ax.semilogy(frequencies, power_spectrum, 'b-', linewidth=2)
572        ax.set_xlabel('Frequency (Hz)')
573        ax.set_ylabel('Power Spectral Density')
574        ax.set_title('Frequency Domain Analysis')
575        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
576
577    def _plot_histogram_with_fit(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
578        """Plot histogram with distribution fit."""
579        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
580
581        if not dist_data:
582            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
583            ax.set_title('Histogram with Fit')
584            return
585
586        # Histogram
587        n, bins, patches = ax.hist(dist_data, bins=30, alpha=0.7, density=True, color='lightblue', edgecolor='black')
588
589        # Fit multiple distributions and overlay
590        distributions = [stats.norm, stats.lognorm, stats.gamma]
591        colors = ['red', 'green', 'orange']
592
593        x = np.linspace(np.min(dist_data), np.max(dist_data), 100)
594
595        for dist, color in zip(distributions, colors):
596            try:
597                params = dist.fit(dist_data)
598                y = dist.pdf(x, *params)
599                ax.plot(x, y, color=color, linewidth=2, label=f'{dist.name} fit')
600            except:
601                continue
602
603        ax.set_xlabel('Value')
604        ax.set_ylabel('Density')
605        ax.set_title('Distribution Fit Comparison')
606        ax.legend()
607
608    def _plot_qq_plot(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
609        """Plot Q-Q plot for normality assessment."""
610        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
611
612        if not dist_data:
613            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
614            ax.set_title('Q-Q Plot')
615            return
616
617        stats.probplot(dist_data, dist="norm", plot=ax)
618        ax.set_title('Q-Q Plot (Normal Distribution)')
619        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
620
621    def _plot_box_plot_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
622        """Plot box plot with outlier analysis."""
623        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
624
625        if not dist_data:
626            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
627            ax.set_title('Box Plot Analysis')
628            return
629
630        box_plot = ax.boxplot([dist_data], patch_artist=True, labels=['Data'])
631        box_plot['boxes'][0].set_facecolor('lightblue')
632
633        # Add mean marker
634        mean_val = np.mean(dist_data)
635        ax.scatter([1], [mean_val], color='red', s=50, marker='D', label=f'Mean: {mean_val:.3f}')
636
637        ax.set_ylabel('Value')
638        ax.set_title('Box Plot with Outliers')
639        ax.legend()
640        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
641
642    def _plot_density_comparison(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
643        """Plot probability density comparison."""
644        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
645
646        if not dist_data:
647            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
648            ax.set_title('Density Comparison')
649            return
650
651        # Kernel density estimation
652        from scipy.stats import gaussian_kde
653        kde = gaussian_kde(dist_data)
654        x = np.linspace(np.min(dist_data), np.max(dist_data), 100)
655        kde_density = kde(x)
656
657        ax.plot(x, kde_density, 'b-', linewidth=2, label='KDE')
658
659        # Normal distribution overlay
660        mu, sigma = stats.norm.fit(dist_data)
661        normal_density = stats.norm.pdf(x, mu, sigma)
662        ax.plot(x, normal_density, 'r--', linewidth=2, label='Normal fit')
663
664        ax.set_xlabel('Value')
665        ax.set_ylabel('Density')
666        ax.set_title('Density Comparison')
667        ax.legend()
668        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
669
670    def _plot_correlation_heatmap(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
671        """Plot correlation heatmap."""
672        correlation_data = self._extract_correlation_data(data)
673
674        if correlation_data is None:
675            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No correlation data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
676            ax.set_title('Correlation Heatmap')
677            return
678
679        im = ax.imshow(correlation_data, cmap='RdBu_r', vmin=-1, vmax=1, aspect='auto')
680
681        # Add colorbar
682        plt.colorbar(im, ax=ax)
683
684        # Add correlation values as text
685        n_vars = correlation_data.shape[0]
686        for i in range(n_vars):
687            for j in range(n_vars):
688                text = ax.text(j, i, f'{correlation_data[i, j]:.2f}',
689                             ha="center", va="center", color="black" if abs(correlation_data[i, j]) < 0.5 else "white")
690
691        ax.set_title('Correlation Matrix')
692        ax.set_xticks(range(n_vars))
693        ax.set_yticks(range(n_vars))
694

699        ax.set_title('Correlation Network')

733    # Data extraction helper methods
734
735    def _extract_metrics_from_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, float]:
736        """Extract metrics from analysis data."""
737        metrics = {}
738
739        # Look for various metric structures
740        if isinstance(data, dict):
741            for key, value in data.items():
742                if isinstance(value, (int, float)) and np.isfinite(value):
743                    metrics[key] = value
744                elif isinstance(value, dict):
745                    if 'mean' in value and isinstance(value['mean'], (int, float)):
746                        metrics[key] = value['mean']
747                    elif 'value' in value and isinstance(value['value'], (int, float)):
748                        metrics[key] = value['value']
749
750        return metrics
751
752    def _extract_time_series_from_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]:
753        """Extract time series data."""
754        time_series = {}
755
756        # Look for time series patterns in data
757        if 'time_series' in data:
758            return data['time_series']
759
760        # Look for arrays that could be time series
761        for key, value in data.items():
762            if isinstance(value, (list, np.ndarray)) and len(value) > 1:
763                try:
764                    y_values = np.array(value)
765                    x_values = np.arange(len(y_values))
766                    time_series[key] = (x_values, y_values)
767                except:
768                    continue
769
770        return time_series
771
772    def _extract_distribution_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[np.ndarray]:
773        """Extract data for distribution analysis."""
774        # Look for distribution data
775        for key, value in data.items():
776            if isinstance(value, (list, np.ndarray)):
777                try:
778                    dist_data = np.array(value).flatten()
779                    if len(dist_data) > 10 and np.all(np.isfinite(dist_data)):
780                        return dist_data
781                except:
782                    continue
783
784        return None
785
786    def _extract_quality_metrics(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, float]:
787        """Extract quality metrics."""
788        quality_metrics = {}
789
790        # Look for quality-related metrics
791        quality_keywords = ['quality', 'score', 'index', 'rating', 'grade']
792
793        for key, value in data.items():
794            if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in quality_keywords):
795                if isinstance(value, (int, float)) and np.isfinite(value):
796                    quality_metrics[key] = value
797
798        return quality_metrics
799
800    def _extract_comparison_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]:
801        """Extract comparison data between methods."""
802        comparison_data = {}
803
804        # Look for comparison structures
805        if 'comparison' in data or 'methods' in data:
806            comparison_section = data.get('comparison', data.get('methods', {}))
807            if isinstance(comparison_section, dict):
808                for method_name, method_data in comparison_section.items():
809                    if isinstance(method_data, dict):
810                        metrics = self._extract_metrics_from_data(method_data)
811                        if metrics:
812                            comparison_data[method_name] = metrics
813
814        return comparison_data
815
816    def _extract_significance_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]:
817        """Extract statistical significance data."""
818        significance_data = {}
819
820        # Look for significance test results
821        if 'statistical_tests' in data or 'significance' in data:
822            test_data = data.get('statistical_tests', data.get('significance', {}))
823            if isinstance(test_data, dict):
824                for test_name, test_result in test_data.items():
825                    if isinstance(test_result, dict) and 'p_value' in test_result:
826                        significance_data[test_name] = test_result
827
828        return significance_data
829
830    def _extract_effect_size_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, float]:
831        """Extract effect size data."""
832        effect_size_data = {}
833
834        # Look for effect size information
835        if 'effect_sizes' in data:
836            effect_data = data['effect_sizes']
837            if isinstance(effect_data, dict):
838                for comparison, effect_info in effect_data.items():
839                    if isinstance(effect_info, dict):
840                        # Look for various effect size measures
841                        for measure in ['cohens_d', 'effect_size', 'hedges_g']:
842                            if measure in effect_info:
843                                effect_size_data[comparison] = effect_info[measure]
844                                break
845
846        return effect_size_data
847
848    def _extract_residuals_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]:
849        """Extract residuals data."""
850        # Look for residuals in various forms
851        for key in ['residuals', 'errors', 'residual_detection']:
852            if key in data:
853                residual_info = data[key]
854                if isinstance(residual_info, dict) and 'residuals' in residual_info:
855                    residuals = residual_info['residuals']
856                    if isinstance(residuals, (list, np.ndarray)):
857                        residuals_array = np.array(residuals)
858                        times = np.arange(len(residuals_array))
859                        return times, residuals_array
860
861        return None
862
863    def _extract_frequency_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]:
864        """Extract frequency domain data."""
865        # Look for frequency domain analysis results
866        for key in ['frequency_analysis', 'psd_analysis', 'spectral']:
867            if key in data:
868                freq_info = data[key]
869                if isinstance(freq_info, dict):
870                    if 'frequencies' in freq_info and 'power_spectral_density' in freq_info:
871                        frequencies = np.array(freq_info['frequencies'])
872                        psd = np.array(freq_info['power_spectral_density'])
873                        return frequencies, psd
874
875        return None
876
877    def _extract_correlation_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[np.ndarray]:
878        """Extract correlation matrix data."""
879        # Look for correlation matrix
880        if 'correlation_matrix' in data:
881            corr_data = data['correlation_matrix']
882            if isinstance(corr_data, (list, np.ndarray)):
883                return np.array(corr_data)
884
885        return None
886
887
888def create_analysis_plotter(style: str = "scientific", **kwargs) -> AnalysisPlotter:
889    """Factory function to create analysis plotter.
890
891    Parameters
892    ----------
893    style : str, optional
894        Plot style
895    **kwargs
896        Additional configuration parameters
897
898    Returns
899    -------
900    AnalysisPlotter
901        Configured analysis plotter
902    """
903    return AnalysisPlotter(style=style, **kwargs)

ClassesÂ¶

AnalysisPlotterÂ¶

Inherits from: VisualizationGenerator

Professional analysis plotting framework.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class AnalysisPlotter(VisualizationGenerator):
  2    """Professional analysis plotting framework."""
  3
  4    def __init__(self, style: str = "scientific", figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (10, 6),
  5                 dpi: int = 300, color_palette: str = "viridis"):
  6        """Initialize analysis plotter.
  7
  8        Parameters
  9        ----------
 10        style : str, optional
 11            Plot style ("scientific", "presentation", "publication")
 12        figsize : Tuple[float, float], optional
 13            Default figure size
 14        dpi : int, optional
 15            Figure DPI for high-quality output
 16        color_palette : str, optional
 17            Color palette name
 18        """
 19        self.style = style
 20        self.figsize = figsize
 21        self.dpi = dpi
 22        self.color_palette = color_palette
 23        self._setup_style()
 24
 25    def _setup_style(self) -> None:
 26        """Setup matplotlib style for professional plots."""
 27        plt.style.use('seaborn-v0_8' if hasattr(plt.style, 'seaborn-v0_8') else 'default')
 28
 29        # Professional styling
 30        params = {
 31            'figure.figsize': self.figsize,
 32            'figure.dpi': self.dpi,
 33            'font.size': 12,
 34            'axes.labelsize': 14,
 35            'axes.titlesize': 16,
 36            'xtick.labelsize': 12,
 37            'ytick.labelsize': 12,
 38            'legend.fontsize': 12,
 39            'lines.linewidth': 2,
 40            'axes.grid': True,
 41            'grid.alpha': 0.3,
 42            'axes.spines.top': False,
 43            'axes.spines.right': False
 44        }
 45
 46        if self.style == "publication":
 47            params.update({
 48                'font.family': 'serif',
 49                'font.serif': ['Times New Roman'],
 50                'mathtext.fontset': 'stix',
 51                'axes.labelsize': 16,
 52                'axes.titlesize': 18,
 53                'xtick.labelsize': 14,
 54                'ytick.labelsize': 14,
 55                'legend.fontsize': 14
 56            })
 57
 58        plt.rcParams.update(params)
 59
 60    @property
 61    def supported_formats(self) -> List[str]:
 62        """List of supported output formats."""
 63        return ['png', 'pdf', 'svg', 'eps', 'jpg']
 64
 65    def generate(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, **kwargs) -> str:
 66        """Generate visualization from analysis results.
 67
 68        Parameters
 69        ----------
 70        analysis_result : AnalysisResult
 71            Analysis results to visualize
 72        **kwargs
 73            Additional parameters:
 74            - plot_type: Type of plot to generate
 75            - output_path: Path for saving plots
 76            - show_confidence_intervals: Include confidence intervals
 77            - compare_baselines: Baseline data for comparison
 78
 79        Returns
 80        -------
 81        str
 82            Path to generated visualization file
 83        """
 84        plot_type = kwargs.get('plot_type', 'summary')
 85        output_path = kwargs.get('output_path', 'analysis_plot.png')
 86
 87        if plot_type == 'summary':
 88            return self.create_summary_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
 89        elif plot_type == 'performance_comparison':
 90            return self.create_performance_comparison(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
 91        elif plot_type == 'time_series':
 92            return self.create_time_series_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
 93        elif plot_type == 'distribution':
 94            return self.create_distribution_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
 95        elif plot_type == 'correlation_matrix':
 96            return self.create_correlation_matrix(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
 97        elif plot_type == 'control_performance':
 98            return self.create_control_performance_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
 99        else:
100            warnings.warn(f"Unknown plot type: {plot_type}")
101            return self.create_summary_plot(analysis_result, output_path, **kwargs)
102
103    def create_summary_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
104        """Create comprehensive summary plot."""
105        fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(15, 12))
106        fig.suptitle('Analysis Summary Dashboard', fontsize=20, fontweight='bold')
107
108        try:
109            # Extract data from analysis result
110            data = analysis_result.data
111
112            # Plot 1: Key metrics bar chart
113            self._plot_key_metrics(axes[0, 0], data, **kwargs)
114
115            # Plot 2: Performance trends
116            self._plot_performance_trends(axes[0, 1], data, **kwargs)
117
118            # Plot 3: Distribution overview
119            self._plot_distribution_overview(axes[1, 0], data, **kwargs)
120
121            # Plot 4: Quality indicators
122            self._plot_quality_indicators(axes[1, 1], data, **kwargs)
123
124            plt.tight_layout()
125            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
126            plt.close()
127
128            return output_path
129
130        except Exception as e:
131            plt.close()
132            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create summary plot: {e}")
133            return ""
134
135    def create_performance_comparison(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
136        """Create performance comparison visualization."""
137        fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(18, 6))
138        fig.suptitle('Performance Comparison Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
139
140        try:
141            data = analysis_result.data
142
143            # Plot 1: Metric comparison
144            self._plot_metric_comparison(axes[0], data, **kwargs)
145
146            # Plot 2: Statistical significance
147            self._plot_statistical_significance(axes[1], data, **kwargs)
148
149            # Plot 3: Effect sizes
150            self._plot_effect_sizes(axes[2], data, **kwargs)
151
152            plt.tight_layout()
153            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
154            plt.close()
155
156            return output_path
157
158        except Exception as e:
159            plt.close()
160            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create performance comparison: {e}")
161            return ""
162
163    def create_time_series_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
164        """Create time series analysis plot."""

166        fig.suptitle('Time Series Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
167
168        try:
169            data = analysis_result.data
170
171            # Plot 1: Original time series
172            self._plot_time_series_data(axes[0], data, **kwargs)
173
174            # Plot 2: Residuals analysis
175            self._plot_residuals_analysis(axes[1], data, **kwargs)
176
177            # Plot 3: Frequency domain analysis
178            self._plot_frequency_analysis(axes[2], data, **kwargs)
179
180            plt.tight_layout()
181            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
182            plt.close()
183
184            return output_path
185
186        except Exception as e:
187            plt.close()
188            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create time series plot: {e}")
189            return ""

191    def create_distribution_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
192        """Create distribution analysis plot."""
193        fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(14, 10))
194        fig.suptitle('Distribution Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
195
196        try:
197            data = analysis_result.data
198
199            # Plot 1: Histogram with fitted distribution
200            self._plot_histogram_with_fit(axes[0, 0], data, **kwargs)
201
202            # Plot 2: Q-Q plot
203            self._plot_qq_plot(axes[0, 1], data, **kwargs)
204
205            # Plot 3: Box plot with outliers
206            self._plot_box_plot_analysis(axes[1, 0], data, **kwargs)
207
208            # Plot 4: Probability density comparison
209            self._plot_density_comparison(axes[1, 1], data, **kwargs)
210
211            plt.tight_layout()
212            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
213            plt.close()
214
215            return output_path
216
217        except Exception as e:
218            plt.close()
219            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create distribution plot: {e}")
220            return ""

247    def create_control_performance_plot(self, analysis_result: AnalysisResult, output_path: str, **kwargs) -> str:
248        """Create control-specific performance visualization."""
249        fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 3, figsize=(18, 12))
250        fig.suptitle('Control Performance Analysis', fontsize=18, fontweight='bold')
251
252        try:
253            data = analysis_result.data
254
255            # Plot 1: Step response analysis
256            self._plot_step_response_analysis(axes[0, 0], data, **kwargs)
257
258            # Plot 2: Frequency response
259            self._plot_frequency_response(axes[0, 1], data, **kwargs)
260
261            # Plot 3: Stability margins
262            self._plot_stability_margins(axes[0, 2], data, **kwargs)
263
264            # Plot 4: Control effort analysis
265            self._plot_control_effort_analysis(axes[1, 0], data, **kwargs)
266
267            # Plot 5: Robustness analysis
268            self._plot_robustness_analysis(axes[1, 1], data, **kwargs)
269
270            # Plot 6: Performance summary radar
271            self._plot_performance_radar(axes[1, 2], data, **kwargs)
272
273            plt.tight_layout()
274            plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=self.dpi, bbox_inches='tight')
275            plt.close()
276
277            return output_path
278
279        except Exception as e:
280            plt.close()
281            warnings.warn(f"Failed to create control performance plot: {e}")
282            return ""

284    # Helper methods for specific plot types
285
286    def _plot_key_metrics(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
287        """Plot key metrics as bar chart."""
288        # Extract metrics from data
289        metrics = self._extract_metrics_from_data(data)
290
291        if not metrics:
292            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No metrics available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
293            ax.set_title('Key Metrics')
294            return
295
296        metric_names = list(metrics.keys())
297        metric_values = list(metrics.values())
298
299        # Create bar plot
300        bars = ax.bar(range(len(metric_names)), metric_values,
301                     color=plt.cm.get_cmap(self.color_palette)(np.linspace(0, 1, len(metric_names))))
302
303        ax.set_xlabel('Metrics')
304        ax.set_ylabel('Values')
305        ax.set_title('Key Performance Metrics')
306        ax.set_xticks(range(len(metric_names)))
307        ax.set_xticklabels(metric_names, rotation=45, ha='right')
308
309        # Add value labels on bars
310        for i, (bar, value) in enumerate(zip(bars, metric_values)):
311            ax.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2, bar.get_height() + 0.01*max(metric_values),
312                   f'{value:.3f}', ha='center', va='bottom')
313
314    def _plot_performance_trends(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
315        """Plot performance trends over time or iterations."""
316        # Look for time series data
317        time_data = self._extract_time_series_from_data(data)
318
319        if not time_data:
320            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No trend data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
321            ax.set_title('Performance Trends')
322            return
323
324        for series_name, (x_values, y_values) in time_data.items():
325            ax.plot(x_values, y_values, label=series_name, linewidth=2)
326
327        ax.set_xlabel('Time/Iteration')
328        ax.set_ylabel('Performance')
329        ax.set_title('Performance Trends')
330        ax.legend()
331        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
332
333    def _plot_distribution_overview(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
334        """Plot distribution overview."""
335        # Extract distribution data
336        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
337
338        if not dist_data:
339            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
340            ax.set_title('Distribution Overview')
341            return
342
343        # Create histogram
344        ax.hist(dist_data, bins=30, alpha=0.7, density=True, color='skyblue', edgecolor='black')
345
346        # Overlay normal distribution fit
347        try:
348            mu, sigma = stats.norm.fit(dist_data)
349            x = np.linspace(np.min(dist_data), np.max(dist_data), 100)
350            y = stats.norm.pdf(x, mu, sigma)
351            ax.plot(x, y, 'r-', linewidth=2, label=f'Normal fit (Î¼={mu:.3f}, Ïƒ={sigma:.3f})')
352        except:
353            pass
354
355        ax.set_xlabel('Value')
356        ax.set_ylabel('Density')
357        ax.set_title('Data Distribution')
358        ax.legend()
359
360    def _plot_quality_indicators(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
361        """Plot quality indicators as gauge-style visualization."""
362        # Extract quality metrics
363        quality_metrics = self._extract_quality_metrics(data)
364
365        if not quality_metrics:
366            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No quality metrics available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
367            ax.set_title('Quality Indicators')
368            return
369
370        # Create gauge plot
371        n_metrics = len(quality_metrics)
372        angles = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, n_metrics, endpoint=False)
373
374        metric_names = list(quality_metrics.keys())
375        metric_values = [quality_metrics[name] for name in metric_names]
376
377        # Normalize values to 0-1 range
378        max_val = max(metric_values) if metric_values else 1
379        normalized_values = [v/max_val for v in metric_values]
380
381        # Create polar plot
382        ax.remove()
383        ax = plt.subplot(2, 2, 4, projection='polar')
384
385        ax.plot(angles, normalized_values, 'o-', linewidth=2, color='blue')
386        ax.fill(angles, normalized_values, alpha=0.25, color='blue')
387
388        ax.set_xticks(angles)
389        ax.set_xticklabels(metric_names)
390        ax.set_ylim(0, 1)
391        ax.set_title('Quality Indicators', pad=20)
392
393    def _plot_metric_comparison(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
394        """Plot metric comparison between methods."""
395        comparison_data = self._extract_comparison_data(data)
396
397        if not comparison_data:
398            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No comparison data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
399            ax.set_title('Metric Comparison')
400            return
401
402        methods = list(comparison_data.keys())
403        metrics = list(comparison_data[methods[0]].keys()) if methods else []
404
405        x = np.arange(len(metrics))
406        width = 0.35
407
408        for i, method in enumerate(methods):
409            values = [comparison_data[method].get(metric, 0) for metric in metrics]
410            ax.bar(x + i*width, values, width, label=method, alpha=0.8)
411
412        ax.set_xlabel('Metrics')
413        ax.set_ylabel('Values')
414        ax.set_title('Method Comparison')
415        ax.set_xticks(x + width/2)
416        ax.set_xticklabels(metrics, rotation=45, ha='right')
417        ax.legend()
418
419    def _plot_statistical_significance(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
420        """Plot statistical significance results."""
421        # Extract p-values and significance results
422        significance_data = self._extract_significance_data(data)
423
424        if not significance_data:
425            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No significance data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
426            ax.set_title('Statistical Significance')
427            return
428
429        comparisons = list(significance_data.keys())
430        p_values = [significance_data[comp].get('p_value', 1.0) for comp in comparisons]
431
432        # Create significance plot
433        colors = ['red' if p < 0.05 else 'gray' for p in p_values]
434        bars = ax.barh(range(len(comparisons)), [-np.log10(p) for p in p_values], color=colors, alpha=0.7)
435
436        ax.axvline(x=-np.log10(0.05), color='red', linestyle='--', label='Î± = 0.05')
437        ax.set_xlabel('-logâ‚â‚€(p-value)')
438        ax.set_ylabel('Comparisons')
439        ax.set_title('Statistical Significance')
440        ax.set_yticks(range(len(comparisons)))
441        ax.set_yticklabels(comparisons)
442        ax.legend()
443
444    def _plot_effect_sizes(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
445        """Plot effect sizes."""
446        effect_size_data = self._extract_effect_size_data(data)
447
448        if not effect_size_data:
449            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No effect size data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
450            ax.set_title('Effect Sizes')
451            return
452
453        comparisons = list(effect_size_data.keys())
454        effect_sizes = [effect_size_data[comp] for comp in comparisons]
455
456        # Create effect size plot with interpretation colors
457        colors = []
458        for es in effect_sizes:
459            abs_es = abs(es)
460            if abs_es < 0.2:
461                colors.append('lightgray')  # Negligible
462            elif abs_es < 0.5:
463                colors.append('lightblue')  # Small
464            elif abs_es < 0.8:
465                colors.append('orange')     # Medium
466            else:
467                colors.append('red')        # Large
468
469        bars = ax.barh(range(len(comparisons)), effect_sizes, color=colors, alpha=0.7)
470
471        ax.axvline(x=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
472        ax.axvline(x=0.2, color='blue', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Small')
473        ax.axvline(x=0.5, color='orange', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Medium')
474        ax.axvline(x=0.8, color='red', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, label='Large')
475
476        ax.set_xlabel("Cohen's d")
477        ax.set_ylabel('Comparisons')
478        ax.set_title('Effect Sizes')
479        ax.set_yticks(range(len(comparisons)))
480        ax.set_yticklabels(comparisons)
481        ax.legend()
482
483    def _plot_time_series_data(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
484        """Plot time series data."""
485        time_series = self._extract_time_series_from_data(data)
486
487        if not time_series:
488            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No time series data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
489            ax.set_title('Time Series Data')
490            return
491
492        for series_name, (times, values) in time_series.items():
493            ax.plot(times, values, label=series_name, linewidth=1.5)
494
495        ax.set_xlabel('Time')
496        ax.set_ylabel('Value')
497        ax.set_title('Time Series Data')
498        ax.legend()
499        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
500
501    def _plot_residuals_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
502        """Plot residuals analysis."""
503        residuals_data = self._extract_residuals_data(data)
504
505        if not residuals_data:
506            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No residuals data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
507            ax.set_title('Residuals Analysis')
508            return
509
510        times, residuals = residuals_data
511
512        ax.plot(times, residuals, 'b-', alpha=0.7, linewidth=1)
513        ax.axhline(y=0, color='red', linestyle='--', alpha=0.7)
514
515        # Add confidence bands
516        std_residuals = np.std(residuals)
517        ax.fill_between(times, -2*std_residuals, 2*std_residuals, alpha=0.2, color='gray', label='Â±2Ïƒ')
518
519        ax.set_xlabel('Time')
520        ax.set_ylabel('Residuals')
521        ax.set_title('Residuals Analysis')
522        ax.legend()
523        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
524
525    def _plot_frequency_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
526        """Plot frequency domain analysis."""
527        freq_data = self._extract_frequency_data(data)
528
529        if not freq_data:
530            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No frequency data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
531            ax.set_title('Frequency Analysis')
532            return
533
534        frequencies, power_spectrum = freq_data
535
536        ax.semilogy(frequencies, power_spectrum, 'b-', linewidth=2)
537        ax.set_xlabel('Frequency (Hz)')
538        ax.set_ylabel('Power Spectral Density')
539        ax.set_title('Frequency Domain Analysis')
540        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
541
542    def _plot_histogram_with_fit(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
543        """Plot histogram with distribution fit."""
544        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
545
546        if not dist_data:
547            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
548            ax.set_title('Histogram with Fit')
549            return
550
551        # Histogram
552        n, bins, patches = ax.hist(dist_data, bins=30, alpha=0.7, density=True, color='lightblue', edgecolor='black')
553
554        # Fit multiple distributions and overlay
555        distributions = [stats.norm, stats.lognorm, stats.gamma]
556        colors = ['red', 'green', 'orange']
557
558        x = np.linspace(np.min(dist_data), np.max(dist_data), 100)
559
560        for dist, color in zip(distributions, colors):
561            try:
562                params = dist.fit(dist_data)
563                y = dist.pdf(x, *params)
564                ax.plot(x, y, color=color, linewidth=2, label=f'{dist.name} fit')
565            except:
566                continue
567
568        ax.set_xlabel('Value')
569        ax.set_ylabel('Density')
570        ax.set_title('Distribution Fit Comparison')
571        ax.legend()
572
573    def _plot_qq_plot(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
574        """Plot Q-Q plot for normality assessment."""
575        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
576
577        if not dist_data:
578            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
579            ax.set_title('Q-Q Plot')
580            return
581
582        stats.probplot(dist_data, dist="norm", plot=ax)
583        ax.set_title('Q-Q Plot (Normal Distribution)')
584        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
585
586    def _plot_box_plot_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
587        """Plot box plot with outlier analysis."""
588        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
589
590        if not dist_data:
591            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
592            ax.set_title('Box Plot Analysis')
593            return
594
595        box_plot = ax.boxplot([dist_data], patch_artist=True, labels=['Data'])
596        box_plot['boxes'][0].set_facecolor('lightblue')
597
598        # Add mean marker
599        mean_val = np.mean(dist_data)
600        ax.scatter([1], [mean_val], color='red', s=50, marker='D', label=f'Mean: {mean_val:.3f}')
601
602        ax.set_ylabel('Value')
603        ax.set_title('Box Plot with Outliers')
604        ax.legend()
605        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
606
607    def _plot_density_comparison(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
608        """Plot probability density comparison."""
609        dist_data = self._extract_distribution_data(data)
610
611        if not dist_data:
612            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No distribution data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
613            ax.set_title('Density Comparison')
614            return
615
616        # Kernel density estimation
617        from scipy.stats import gaussian_kde
618        kde = gaussian_kde(dist_data)
619        x = np.linspace(np.min(dist_data), np.max(dist_data), 100)
620        kde_density = kde(x)
621
622        ax.plot(x, kde_density, 'b-', linewidth=2, label='KDE')
623
624        # Normal distribution overlay
625        mu, sigma = stats.norm.fit(dist_data)
626        normal_density = stats.norm.pdf(x, mu, sigma)
627        ax.plot(x, normal_density, 'r--', linewidth=2, label='Normal fit')
628
629        ax.set_xlabel('Value')
630        ax.set_ylabel('Density')
631        ax.set_title('Density Comparison')
632        ax.legend()
633        ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
634
635    def _plot_correlation_heatmap(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
636        """Plot correlation heatmap."""
637        correlation_data = self._extract_correlation_data(data)
638
639        if correlation_data is None:
640            ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'No correlation data available', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
641            ax.set_title('Correlation Heatmap')
642            return
643
644        im = ax.imshow(correlation_data, cmap='RdBu_r', vmin=-1, vmax=1, aspect='auto')
645
646        # Add colorbar
647        plt.colorbar(im, ax=ax)
648
649        # Add correlation values as text
650        n_vars = correlation_data.shape[0]
651        for i in range(n_vars):
652            for j in range(n_vars):
653                text = ax.text(j, i, f'{correlation_data[i, j]:.2f}',
654                             ha="center", va="center", color="black" if abs(correlation_data[i, j]) < 0.5 else "white")
655
656        ax.set_title('Correlation Matrix')
657        ax.set_xticks(range(n_vars))
658        ax.set_yticks(range(n_vars))
659
660    def _plot_correlation_network(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
661        """Plot correlation network diagram."""
662        # Simplified network visualization
663        ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'Correlation Network\n(Implementation pending)', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
664        ax.set_title('Correlation Network')
665

669        """Plot step response analysis."""

671        ax.set_title('Step Response')
672
673    def _plot_frequency_response(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
674        """Plot frequency response."""
675        ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'Frequency Response\n(Implementation pending)', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
676        ax.set_title('Frequency Response')
677
678    def _plot_stability_margins(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
679        """Plot stability margins."""
680        ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'Stability Margins\n(Implementation pending)', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
681        ax.set_title('Stability Margins')
682
683    def _plot_control_effort_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
684        """Plot control effort analysis."""
685        ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'Control Effort Analysis\n(Implementation pending)', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
686        ax.set_title('Control Effort')
687
688    def _plot_robustness_analysis(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
689        """Plot robustness analysis."""
690        ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'Robustness Analysis\n(Implementation pending)', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
691        ax.set_title('Robustness')
692
693    def _plot_performance_radar(self, ax, data: Dict[str, Any], **kwargs) -> None:
694        """Plot performance radar chart."""
695        ax.text(0.5, 0.5, 'Performance Radar\n(Implementation pending)', ha='center', va='center', transform=ax.transAxes)
696        ax.set_title('Performance Radar')
697
698    # Data extraction helper methods
699
700    def _extract_metrics_from_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, float]:
701        """Extract metrics from analysis data."""
702        metrics = {}
703
704        # Look for various metric structures
705        if isinstance(data, dict):
706            for key, value in data.items():
707                if isinstance(value, (int, float)) and np.isfinite(value):
708                    metrics[key] = value
709                elif isinstance(value, dict):
710                    if 'mean' in value and isinstance(value['mean'], (int, float)):
711                        metrics[key] = value['mean']
712                    elif 'value' in value and isinstance(value['value'], (int, float)):
713                        metrics[key] = value['value']
714
715        return metrics
716
717    def _extract_time_series_from_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]:
718        """Extract time series data."""
719        time_series = {}
720
721        # Look for time series patterns in data
722        if 'time_series' in data:
723            return data['time_series']
724
725        # Look for arrays that could be time series
726        for key, value in data.items():
727            if isinstance(value, (list, np.ndarray)) and len(value) > 1:
728                try:
729                    y_values = np.array(value)
730                    x_values = np.arange(len(y_values))
731                    time_series[key] = (x_values, y_values)
732                except:
733                    continue
734
735        return time_series
736
737    def _extract_distribution_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[np.ndarray]:
738        """Extract data for distribution analysis."""
739        # Look for distribution data
740        for key, value in data.items():
741            if isinstance(value, (list, np.ndarray)):
742                try:
743                    dist_data = np.array(value).flatten()
744                    if len(dist_data) > 10 and np.all(np.isfinite(dist_data)):
745                        return dist_data
746                except:
747                    continue
748
749        return None
750
751    def _extract_quality_metrics(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, float]:
752        """Extract quality metrics."""
753        quality_metrics = {}
754
755        # Look for quality-related metrics
756        quality_keywords = ['quality', 'score', 'index', 'rating', 'grade']
757
758        for key, value in data.items():
759            if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in quality_keywords):
760                if isinstance(value, (int, float)) and np.isfinite(value):
761                    quality_metrics[key] = value
762
763        return quality_metrics
764
765    def _extract_comparison_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]:
766        """Extract comparison data between methods."""
767        comparison_data = {}
768
769        # Look for comparison structures
770        if 'comparison' in data or 'methods' in data:
771            comparison_section = data.get('comparison', data.get('methods', {}))
772            if isinstance(comparison_section, dict):
773                for method_name, method_data in comparison_section.items():
774                    if isinstance(method_data, dict):
775                        metrics = self._extract_metrics_from_data(method_data)
776                        if metrics:
777                            comparison_data[method_name] = metrics
778
779        return comparison_data
780
781    def _extract_significance_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]:
782        """Extract statistical significance data."""
783        significance_data = {}
784
785        # Look for significance test results
786        if 'statistical_tests' in data or 'significance' in data:
787            test_data = data.get('statistical_tests', data.get('significance', {}))
788            if isinstance(test_data, dict):
789                for test_name, test_result in test_data.items():
790                    if isinstance(test_result, dict) and 'p_value' in test_result:
791                        significance_data[test_name] = test_result
792
793        return significance_data
794
795    def _extract_effect_size_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, float]:
796        """Extract effect size data."""
797        effect_size_data = {}
798
799        # Look for effect size information
800        if 'effect_sizes' in data:
801            effect_data = data['effect_sizes']
802            if isinstance(effect_data, dict):
803                for comparison, effect_info in effect_data.items():
804                    if isinstance(effect_info, dict):
805                        # Look for various effect size measures
806                        for measure in ['cohens_d', 'effect_size', 'hedges_g']:
807                            if measure in effect_info:
808                                effect_size_data[comparison] = effect_info[measure]
809                                break
810
811        return effect_size_data
812
813    def _extract_residuals_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]:
814        """Extract residuals data."""
815        # Look for residuals in various forms
816        for key in ['residuals', 'errors', 'residual_detection']:
817            if key in data:
818                residual_info = data[key]
819                if isinstance(residual_info, dict) and 'residuals' in residual_info:
820                    residuals = residual_info['residuals']
821                    if isinstance(residuals, (list, np.ndarray)):
822                        residuals_array = np.array(residuals)
823                        times = np.arange(len(residuals_array))
824                        return times, residuals_array
825
826        return None
827
828    def _extract_frequency_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]:
829        """Extract frequency domain data."""
830        # Look for frequency domain analysis results
831        for key in ['frequency_analysis', 'psd_analysis', 'spectral']:
832            if key in data:
833                freq_info = data[key]
834                if isinstance(freq_info, dict):
835                    if 'frequencies' in freq_info and 'power_spectral_density' in freq_info:
836                        frequencies = np.array(freq_info['frequencies'])
837                        psd = np.array(freq_info['power_spectral_density'])
838                        return frequencies, psd
839
840        return None
841
842    def _extract_correlation_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[np.ndarray]:
843        """Extract correlation matrix data."""
844        # Look for correlation matrix
845        if 'correlation_matrix' in data:
846            corr_data = data['correlation_matrix']
847            if isinstance(corr_data, (list, np.ndarray)):
848                return np.array(corr_data)
849
850        return None
